data.title: Millenials , owner learn a lesson
data.text:
STOP ACTING LIKE YOUR BORED TO TEARS TO BE WORKING..  Seriously, goodness forbid you'd treat a customer as if they are actually the ones paying your paycheck, eye contact, a smile go a long way..

That said 3 donuts for 8.50 is outrageous ESPECIALLY since two of them were just sugar and cinnamon simple donuts ... 

I dont drink coffee shop I can't comment .

data.title: Great atmosphere, good pies, and a great place to hang out!
data.text:
Located near the "Old West-End" in Toledo, OH, Black Kite Coffe & Pies is the gem I've been looking for since moving here a few days ago (and let me tell you, I've been biking around like crazy in search of this place). The staff is nice and welcoming, their taste in music is indie-oriented, and decorations (odd glass vases, low hanging lamps, chalkboard menus, and a variety of seating options) means that this place has a ton of character.
Their fresh-squeezed juice is good, but probably not worth the $3.50 it cost me to have some, but their pies are pretty darn good (more like calzones). The pies change flavor every week- this week they are hitting the Pokémon-Go theme (Porkachu and Vegemon Go!), and I was not disappointed (especially with their Siracha sauce).

Overall, this was the perfect place to plop down after a long bike-ride, read my book, study up on economics (of course I'm a medical student so that will be relevant), and to catch up with my brother who is currently hanging out in a coffee shop in Seattle. Wa. Lets just say that despite their "best coffee", Black Kite is certainly giving Seattle a run for their money.

data.title: Unplanned Stop Made For Spectacular Morning!
data.text:
Headed downtown Toledo to meet my friend for breakfast, and the restaurant was unexpectedly closed. We regrouped and decided on a different restaurant but needed to stall for 40 minutes until it opened - perfect timing to grab a cup of coffee. Which we did at Black Kite Coffee! We LOVED it! The atmosphere was filled with families dining together, sipping coffee and listening to a 'morning story time'. 
We were served our coffee quickly, and it was super! I will go back, and take more friends with me!

data.title: Friendly, comfy, tasty pies
data.text:
The first time we stopped here it was early afternoon, we'd missed lunch and wanted coffee and food. On the menu: roast pork and winter squash pies (more a pasty than a pie, the crust completely envelops the filling). They were totally delicious, especially with the dipping sauce/dressing.  The chairs are comfy, the vibe is mellow - we returned.  This time the pie-of-the-day was turkey pot pie, maybe even better than the pork-and-squash.  
The cinnamon rolls are great, the breakfast rolls a bit heavy - definitely comfort food, the coffee very good and the fresh orange juice delish.  We haven't tried anything else on the fairly limited menu (soup, salad,pies and pastries), but hope to work our way through it all as the year rolls along.  
Added bonuses: Holey Toledough donuts and customer cards offering benefits after one buys a certain number of drinks (or coffee only? I forgot to ask.) Bohemian, colorful, uncluttered, serene, and very friendly, helpful staff.

data.title: watery coffee
data.text: We stopped in here after visiting at a local hospital.  The venue has all you want in a great coffee shop.  I can see it being a great location at night as well.  The donuts looked amazing as did the pie, but we weren't in it for food.  The coffee was a watery disappointment.  This place could be so great! Make better coffee!!

data.title: Perk up buttercup
data.text: Our barista today 12/26/15 wished she was dead, or at home or dead at home. Really ...she wished she was anywhere but there.  Terrible attitude before I even stepped up to order. I got an Americano and a Chai Tea and you would have thought I asked her to tap dance while doing it. Relax honey! No one is forcing you to work there!

data.title: Classic Gritty Urban Cafe
data.text: I stopped in recently for the first time and fell in love with Black Kite. The place is a classic gritty urban cafe, complete with local art for sale. Black kite offers a relaxed setting, great staff, and better food and drinks. I love it. I highly recommend the Holey Toledoughs!

data.title: Yum
data.text: Phenomenal food and flavor. Awesome menu options, coffee, atmosphere. Helpful staff, good room, easy to find and park.

data.title: Saturday breakfast is to die for.
data.text: This is a little coffee shop opened by Unban explorer Kristen Kaiser. She brought boutique coffee to a inner city neighbourhood in the middle of a dramatic rebuilding and others have followed.  Musicians come to play on the weekends and that along with the French toast is well worth the effort.

data.title: I will try again...
data.text:
I will try again...because this is a local place that I really want to like and support.  We went for the first time on a Saturday at 1015.  The young woman at the counter could not have appeared less interested in our business.  We made it clear the place was new to us, we asked questions about the brunch food beginning at 1030, we ordered an assortment, we are smiley and friendly people, we weren't delaying people behind us.
On our way out, since I did like the coffee and pastries we tried,that they are located on Collingwood, and that they were having a kids' story hour (don't personally have young kids, but appreciate the effort) I knew that we would try to come back for brunch.  We asked if they had a website (as I've searched "toledo brunch" many times and they've never come up) and I wanted info on hours, etc to refer to.  They said they had a Facebook page.  Not nearly as helpful.
Get out of your own way, Black Kite! Have you seen Katalina's in Columbus?  You have a much better physical plant and have great potential.  I want you to make it work.

data.title: Great brunch
data.text:
The first time we came here was for the Saturday morning brunch. It was spectacular! The atmosphere was relaxing and laid back and the food was beautifully presented and wonderful.

We did come back on a weekday for lunch and it was just average. The only choice for food was a meat or vegetarian pie. The meat pie was kind of bland but the dipping sauce made up for that. Vegetarian pie was okay but not my cup of tea. I didn't really care for the sauce with a vegetarian pie. If you were going to come here for food your best bet is to come for the Saturday brunch it is worth it, any other time..meh.

data.title: Real coffee, great service!
data.text: In toledo's Old West End area, this place has real coffee, roasted by Flying Rhino. Excellent coffee in toledo!! Great service, and we're enjoying the cookies too!

data.title: dry pie
data.text: the pies were dry and underbaked.  the salad was average.  service was friendly, but my server had to keep calling to a co-worker to "work".  he was just standing around talking and not doing much at all.  will go back to try teas and coffee, maybe a pastry.
